Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.PresentationLayer.UseCaseDiagram

Class UseCaseDiagram

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.PresentationLayer.UseCaseDiagram.UseCaseDiagram
public class UseCaseDiagram extends Object

Use Case Diagram Controller

The UseCaseDiagram class serves as the controller for the Use Case Diagram editor within the UML Editor application. It manages the creation, manipulation, and visualization of use case diagrams, including actors, use cases, and their relationships such as associations, includes, and extends. The class handles user interactions, rendering of diagram elements on the canvas, and provides functionalities to save, load, and export diagrams in both serialized and JSON formats.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

  • Method Details

    • redrawCanvas

      public void redrawCanvas()
      Redraws the entire use case diagram on the canvas, including system boundary, objects, and associations.

      This method clears the current canvas, redraws the system boundary, iterates through all objects to draw them, iterates through all associations to draw them, and highlights the selected object if any.

    • applyHoverEffect

      public void applyHoverEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Applies a hover effect to a Button when the mouse enters its area.

      This method changes the button's background color, font size, and scaling to indicate a hover state.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggered by the mouse entering the button area.

    • removeHoverEffect

      public void removeHoverEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Removes the hover effect from a Button when the mouse exits its area.

      This method reverts the button's background color, font size, and scaling to its default state.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggered by the mouse exiting the button area.

    • applyClickEffect

      public void applyClickEffect(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Applies a click effect to a Button when it is clicked.

      This method changes the button's background color and ensures its scaling is reset, indicating a clicked state.

      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The MouseEvent triggered by the button click.
